title: The old Rune System wasn't perfect, but it was better than this.
body:
It had issues, sure.

1. You should have been able to edit rune pages in champion select.
2. The IP sink that was "unlocking every rune" was absurd.
3. Tier 1 and 2 runes were just a trap, flat out.
4. The differences in power between runes were astonishing. 

...but none of those made the system irreparable.

Issue 1 was a simple fix.
Issues 2 and 3 **were fixed**, but you waited to do it *until Runes were set to be phased out*.
Issue 4 is a simple matter of balancing out runes, something I don't recall happening since the removal of Dodge Chance.

Sure it wasn't super interesting, but it didn't have to be.
Hell, I'd rather this kind of thing *wasn't* super interesting.
Power along the lines of Electrocute, Conqueror, Lethal Tempo, Predator... none of this shit should be a part of the runes, it should be in the form of new items, summoner spells, and champions.

It's not like it was devoid of strategy, it just *looked* that way because you didn't *let us* strategize by editing runes.

Stacking armor as Amumu top to become immune to minion damage? Sure.
Hybrid Pen Thresh for all in damage? Seems legit.
XP runes on Talon for first blood? Sounds good to me.

Masteries are the only one that needed a rework. For those, I think something along the lines of the Odyssey customization (at a lower power level) would have been the way to go.

I really miss them, man.

Fights were so fun when you actually had to do more than just throw out one spell rotation.

I remember filling out most of the runes with magic pen + cdr for Malzahar or doing full armor for malphite among other things

fun times
I'd say only tier 2 runes were a trap, tier 1 runes were so cheap that it barely hurt you to get a full tier 1 runepage
Honestly, I prefer the new rune system. I think it is more beginner friendly than the old version.
Which had a lot to do with the old system costing an incredible amount to just try things out?

It was also a lot of the old system being a lot of shit and 90% of it being garbage.

The problem with things that are *just* stats is that there's only one perfect build with them, and everything else is subpar.
The old runes and mastery system, had little effects to gamplay but still help define how you wanted to play. now the rune pages determine who wins lanes over skill gap

I would have to agree on you with this one. I had 3 rune pages that used to really throw people off that I absolutely loved because it let me do odd things with certain champs. 

46armor 43 MR level 18
Full mana regen. 13/5
Full Hp regen page (used till season 6)

I loved starting cloth armor on nasus vs riven and starting the game with 92 armor with the old system.

It completely flipped the outcome of the match-up.

That's a valid point, you can't have it be too dry or else it's just "this is the best choice". But at the same time, I'm getting tired of laning against Press the Attack or Time Warp Tonic, I prefer laning against champions not their keystones.
That's fair, and could be handled by a nerf to runes overall. Doesn't justify going back to the old shitty system, but that's a fair stance.
I don't think I'd want the old system back - I can't honestly say I have a good solution, besides not having runes altogether which is throwing the baby out with the bathwater.

Not just that.

For me personally, the rune page felt extremely redundant. Most of the time, you filled the page with the same type of rune/sigil/whatever.

Selecting 1 offensive rune (AD, AS, CDR), 1 defensive rune (AR, MR, HP), and 1 mixed (AD, AR, MR) is easy to costumize on the fly and just way more intuitive than having to fill this whole page with the same thing repeatedly.

I used to run full AS runes on some champion and full hp or armor on others.

Ppl usually ran runes that were general bcs we did not have option to change them before game in champ select.

Guy is right runes did not define the game champions did and to addition of easier balance for old rune system so was balance of champions around those runes impossible with new runes system.
This game is 10 years old (which is a lot in cyber world) and instead of reaching wisdom they are still acting like sub optimally developed 10 yo kid trying to balance it. They know how they just won't do it. Skill expression was removed via runes and bad matchmaking .

I had an energy regen rune page, a CDR runepage (20% cdr from runes is sweet), an armor runepage, an armor pen runepage, an attack speed runepage, magic pen AND hybrid pen runepages. 

Like my go to runes were: movespeed 4.5%
10% CDR 1.5% movespeed
20% cdr = 3 Quints + 3 glyphs (remaining were whatever).

For most people it was redundant because all you needed was an AD or an AP runepage. A large part of which was caused by a lack of runepages and the sheer cost to get more. 

So your plight is understandable, just do understand that for the people who wanted to it was possible to customize a LOT.

Was there issues with the Old Runes? Of course however as OP already mentioned, it was practically fixed. With the removal of the old Rune Pages, Riot has been more and more hands on in manufacturing metas rather than the players defining it themselves. If something doesnt align with their intentions then they will double down and force the change. In worst case scenarios they would randomly do this on a whim with complete disregard to the playerbase. 

The age of discovery and experimentation has been long gone. Over the past few years its becoming more apparent that we're in the age of manufactured. Reliance and investment into team composition and strategy has been tarnished in favor for quick flashy plays.
I miss being able to really customize what I wanted into each stat. I miss it so much.

I just think there should not have been any "tiers" of runes, and they needed to be free from the get go. Some of the runes that are more niche or less commonly used could have been locked behind levels so there wasnt so much at once.

I think the idea of masteries being champion specific, and ways to alter the way you play THAT specific champion (like odyssey) would be much more manageable and interesting.
I miss my full armor and HP regen "I'm just going to sit in lane and ignore you" Sion.

Old runes were much funnier and diverse. You could have different ways to play a champion by switching the main stats.

Spending money on a champ frees up IP to spend on raw stats. How does your smooth brain get tricked so easily by only one level of obfuscation.

1. Again, no. It's not that simple. 
2. Leona is not a hook support. She's a diver. If Leona is a hook champion, than so are Lee Sin, Sylas, and Akali, who have essentially the same "hook" mechanic as she does.
3. Those stats are from *now*, with damage being so absurd that being stunned for a second means you just die. I'm talking the days of old runes when damage was *much* lower.
4. You do not need to be a healer to be an enchanter. An enchanter is anybody who focuses on buffing their team. Morgana is an enchanter/control mage hybrid. Zilean *was* a pure enchanter, and was reworked into an enchanter/control mage hybrid.
5. No, not "artillery mages". Nami, old Sona, old Taric, and old Soraka could beat these  guys by simply playing well. Nami/Sona poked/traded until they were low on HP. Soraka just sat back there and made sure she wasn't the one who got hooked and then made it impossible to kill her buddy. Taric could out-fight any of the hook supports if they engaged on him and could heal up afterwards.
6. It's self evident. Enchanters can beat hook supports as long as damage is low enough that they can beat them. The introduction of keystones amped up damage to 11, and then runes reforged did it again by filling the lesser runes with damage options.
7. Nope. Pyke is awful at dealing with durable champions. Reverting to old runes leaves him with much less damage to work with as well as opponents who are too tanky for Pyke to burst down.
